name: Yellowstone Park Hotel

reviews.text: great place, extensive breakfast with waffles and all the other usual stuff, very nice indoor pool, rooms were great, beds were very comfortable, satellite TV, free internet in lobby and free fax service. Very new hotel, friendly staff.
reviews.title: awesome hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night, clean hotel, good location. Breakfast very busy and were out of alot of things. Rooms good size and quiet. Many restaurants nearb.
reviews.title: decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and had requested a quiet double queen room. We were not disappointed, the hotel put us on the top floor at the very end of the property in room 327 and indeed the room was very quiet. Our room is in good repair with relatively new clean carpet and two very comfortable queen beds. The room has a thermostat connected to a wall unit that provides both heating and AC. We only used the AC and it works fine. The bathroom has a standard tub/shower. No frills here, it is a molded plastic unit for both tub and shower – but completely functional with reasonable water pressure and hot water. The bathroom has a vent that goes on with the light so steam is easily cleared from the bathroom. The counter in the bath is granite.
reviews.title: Good hotel for it's class

reviews.text: There are two closets in the room behind full-length mirrors. One closet has a rack installed that is too close to the door so one can not hang up clothes perpendicular to the rack because the door will not close. This explains why all the hangers were in the other closet. But you can hang items in the bad closet if you angle them and not put too many things in there.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: There is a flat panel tv and also a standard phone and alarm clock. In addition the room has a small fridge and microwave.
reviews.title: Alright

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled here from California to visit Yellowstone National Park in the winter, and wanted a nice, clean, reasonably priced place to stay. We read a few reviews on this hotel, and decided to try it out. This is one of the newer hotels in West Yellowstone. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, clean and very reasonably priced ($62/night), and the hotel is conveniently located to everything in West Yellowstone - especially the entrance to Yellowstone National Park's West Entrance. A complimentary breakfast is also included in the room price. And, the staff is very cordial. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a nice place to stay in West Yellowstone.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel Stay

reviews.text: I'm placing this review as we are at the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located to the west entrance of Yellowstone, The Grizzly & Wolf Center and town. The post office is located next door. The rooms are complete with a microwave and small refrigerator. Rooms are clean and spacious (room to walk around without bumping into things). The continental breakfast is adequate (cereal, biscuits and gravy, make your own waffles, etc). Hot chocolate and coffee are available all day in the breakfast room. Computer access is available in the rooms via ethernet cable (provided) or wi-fi is available in the breakfast room (no problem connecting). The pool is small with a hot tub for those cold winter nights. The hotel offers a washer and dryer, plus vending machines (snacks and soft drinks). The employees are friendly and willing to provide directions or suggestions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, would recommend....

reviews.text: My wife, our kids and I are cross country skiers. The West Yellowstone Park Hotel has a Good Breakfast, facilities in our room for cooking and storing food (& beer) and the dinning commons are great for cooking lunch and dinner. The rooms are large enough in which we never feel cramped. The employees are very friendly and accommodating in every way. Whenever we come to West Yellowstone to ski we stay at the West Yellowstone Park Hotel. We have also recommended the hotel to many of our friends and they have had similar experiences to our multiple experiences staying in this hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Friendly, Good Value, Clean & New.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spacious rooms, clean, and well kept. Staff was friendly and helpful. Excellent continental breakfast each morning. Beautiful indoor pool. Quiet motel. Our only concern was the noisy heater fan. We will definitely stay on our next trip West Yellowstone.
reviews.title: Great Value with a Great Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff, convenient access to Yellowstone park, and Island Park Idaho.
reviews.title: Very clean and convenient hotel
Stagecoach Inn West Yellowstone
reviews.text: Very nice authentic hotel built in 1948. Great atmosphere and wonderful service.

We were very impressed with the hotel. Friendly, knowledgeagle staff very well informed not only on the local community, but on the best snowmachine trails and outdoor activities in the regional area. Hotel has basic, but nice pool and hottub, we were impressed that a hotel in this price range had such ammenities. Kids loved it!
reviews.title: Exceptional for the money

reviews.text: The hotel rooms were basic, but very clean. Beds were firm, but nice. Breakfast room immaculately clean. Great continential breakfast, fresh-made waffles, biskets and gravy, standard cereals and yogurt. Complimentary hot chocolate all day. Highly recommend the hotel, and our best value for the money in West Yellowstone.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I arrived after midnight at the hotel and had to get the poor attendant out of bed, not a cross look or anything. Nothing but friendly, prompt sign-in with all the information we needed for our stay.
reviews.title: Would book this again
Good clean hotel and great service.
reviews.text: Hot breakfast-made our own waffles that were very tasty. The selectiion did need some protein to accompany the carbs.
We love the pool ,location,&breakfast close to skiing
reviews.title: great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here a week and enjoyed every minute. We used the Trip Advisor to select a hotel for our stay in West Yellowstone so I wanted to share our experience. The hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly, polite, and helpful. Will stay here again on our next trip through this area. Continental breakfast is included.
reviews.title: Clean, and the staff is great

reviews.text: We had a great time and enjoyed the hotel the people were very friendly and accomodating.
reviews.title: Awesome stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently went to Yellowstone and stayed at the Yellowstone Park Hotel. The staff- or should I say- the manager, since she was working all day ,was kind, polite and very helpful. We were greeted with a smile every morning. The room we had was very clean and spacious, had a little trouble figuring out the heater, but the lady at the desk was very kind to come and show us how to work it. we loved their continental breakfast and the biscuits and gravy. The general aspect of the hotel is wonderful, well kept and clean. We will be coming back to stay here in the summer and future winter trips.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay, Will be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I stayed at 4 Yellowstone area locations in 10 days for our 22nd Anniversary (Sept. 15-25,09) This Hotel is newer than a lot of the small inns & Motels around West entrance and in a nice location. $70 a night is good value for newer place compared to touristy lodges. Not a lot of amenities but clean place to rest up. Be sure to watch IMAX film on Yellowstone b4 going in, $4 Matinee for 1st two A.M. shows & $6 for other shows. Buy gifts inside Yellowstone because price is same but 100% of proceeds goes to the park when bought inside. Be sure to pick up Y.Stone park paper at area stores to see times of Ranger guided tours & talks,very good. If Horseback riding is your thing, ride 28 miles south on hwy 20 to Herriman State Park. www.dryridge.com 1/2 day was $55 and trails are fantastic! Forest, streams, mountains, & lush valley with Elk viewing. Diamond P is closer to w.Yellowstone but a little more money and 45 min. flat ride to get to mountain scenery. Nice people too, but worth the trip to Herriman State Park. Just south of the park off hwy 20 is a scenic route thru mountains called Mesa Falls, many lookout photo opps. worth the trip! If Trout fishing is your thing, there is a historical inn called Macs on hwy 20 on the way to Herrimans, where people rented hotel syle rooms & small cabins right on the river. I went in to look, rooms started about $70 a nt. cabins $100, but you could walk out of your door and see the trout swimming in the river! You can keep the trout you catch just buy a license. By Herrimans Park the river there is catch & release. The Anlers Lodge there is Beautiful but a little pricey...our anniversary meal we had there at the restaurant was good and very romantic by the river. We also visited Teton Ntnl Park as $25 Park admission is good for 7 days at both. Super 8 in Driggs is good value $60 but tough going over the mountains to Jackson Hole...The hotels in Jackson Hole are too pricey $130+ for rooms you get in West Y.S. for 1/2 the price. In Alpine, just about 40 miles south of J.H., Flying Saddle Resort is about $70 a nt. and have nice rooms and ranch style atmosphere, worth the drive if going back a 2nd day to Teton Ntnl Park or heading out the next morning after a long day in the park. In Jackson Hole there is a Dollar store which has all the yellowstone suveneirs for $1 each rather than $4 each in the parks. Stock up for the kids to give as gifts at school etc.
reviews.title: Tips for You based on our Yellowstone stay on our 22nd Anniversary

description: Located less than 1/2 mile from the west entrance to Yellowstone National Park, the three diamond rated Yellowstone Park Hotel features 66 well-appointed guest rooms and suites, many featuring fireplaces and whirlpool tubs. Yellowstone Park Hotel is the newest lodging property in West Yellowstone, opening in 2007. Guest rooms feature flat screen TV's, free wireless internet, upgraded linens and luxurious bath robes. The hotel also features an indoor heated pool, hot tub and dry sauna. The Grizzly and Wolf Discovery Center and IMAX® Theatre are a short walk from the hotel.
